name: The CITE architecture
body:
Christopher Blackwell and Neel Smith originally developed the CITE architecture to meet the 
needs of the [Homer Multitext project][1].

## Recent additions ##

- Apr. 7, 2014: **version 1.3 of the [ctsvalidator](https://github.com/cite-architecture/ctsvalidator) servlet** released (testing version 5.0.rc.2 of the [Canonical Text Services protocol](https://github.com/cite-architecture/cts_spec))

## Overview of repositories ##
Public repositories for our CITE architecture on github include:

### Specifications

- [CTS URNs](https://github.com/cite-architecture/ctsurn_spec)
- [Canonical Text Services protocol](https://github.com/cite-architecture/cts_spec)

### Code libraries for working with CITE repositories

- [hocuspocus](https://github.com/cite-architecture/hocuspocus) for working with a text repository
- [prestochango](https://github.com/cite-architecture/prestochango) for working a repository of structured collections
- [nysi](https://github.com/cite-architecture/nysi) for working with an image repository
- [abracadabra](https://github.com/cite-architecture/abracadabra) for working with CITE graphs

###Implementations of the CITE service suite

- [sparqlcts](https://github.com/cite-architecture/sparqlcts):  the Canonical Text Services
- [sparqlcc](https://github.com/cite-architecture/sparqlcc):  the CITE Collection Services
- [sparqlimg](https://github.com/cite-architecture/sparqlimg): the CITE Image Services
- [citegraph](https://github.com/cite-architecture/citegraph): a CITE graph service

### Tools for managing and integrating CITE repositories

- [citemgr](https://github.com/cite-architecture/citemgr): utilities for working with CITE repositories, including generating RDF representations of repositories
- [citeservlet](https://github.com/cite-architecture/citeservlet):  a servlet providing all four of the CITE services

###Utilities

- [cite](https://github.com/cite-architecture/cite), a library for working with URNs and TextInventories
- [ctsvalidator](https://github.com/cite-architecture/ctsvalidator), a harness for running a suite of tests against a CTS installation



[1]: http://homermultitext.github.io/
